title: AAA: Android Faithful is Your New Android Home! - With Jason Howell, Ron Richards, Huyen Tue Dao, and Mishaal Rahman
description: All About Android fans, listen up! If you were disappointed when the show went away, then you'll be happy to know that Jason Howell, Ron Richards, Huyen Tue Dao, and Mishaal Rahman brought the AAA fun to a new home called Android Faithful. Each week, the AF crew discusses the latest news, hardware, and apps for the world's biggest mobile operating system. Special guests, from journalists, to industry big wigs, to execs from inside the Google mothership join the crew to detail the ongoing evolution of Google's Android. Join us and be a part of the Android Faithful! Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Host: Mishaal Rahman Visit AndroidFaithful.com or search your favorite podcatcher to subscribe!
author: TWiT

All About All About Android. title: AAA 634: How Do I Find Them Discords? - Pixel drop, AT&T on Jibe RCS, Tensor G3 details, OnePlus Fold
description: Hands-free photos, SpO2 and more for the Pixel family. @MishaalRahman: Android 14 Beta 3 and Platform Stability. Here is what's new in Android 14 Beta 3. @lockheimer: Today I'm excited to share that we're working with AT&T to accelerate adoption of the RCS standard, and that AT&T's default Android messaging will now be via the Jibe platform, so their users will get the latest RCS features instantly. @MishaalRahman: Google is retiring Android TV 13, I can now confirm. See this thread for the full details on what's changing. @MishaalRahman: I'm looking through the first Android TV 14 beta right now to find what's new! Here's what I've found so far. Exclusive: These are the leaked camera specs for the Google Pixel 8 series. Exclusive: Everything you want to know about the Pixel 8's processor leaked. Join us for the official launch on July 11th, 11:00 EST on nothing.tech. Exclusive Nothing Phone (2) First Look: Get a Sneak Peek at Carl Pei's Highly Anticipated Nothing Phone 2. OnePlus' foldable phone is launching in... August! The Reddit App War Is Getting Messy. Apollo will close down on June 30th. Reddit's recent decisions and actions have unfortunately made it impossible for Apollo to continue. Sync will shut down on June 30, 2023. Pocket Casts for Wear OS is now available in beta. JR's tip of the week: Reading Mode. Followup to fan who wrote about wireless charging issues with Pixel 6 Pro. Pixel 7a fan review: The battery is not good. Why I installed GrapheneOS on the Pixel 7a. Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/3qx3C2n Hosts: Jason Howell and Ron Richards Co-Hosts: Mishaal Rahman and JR Raphael Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. title: AAA 633: Pixel 7a Review - Android feature drop, Motorola Razr Plus, dead Assistant features, Magic Compose beta
description: Connect on the go and learn new skills with new Android features. Build reading skills with a new Google Play Books feature. Google Wallet for Android now supports digital IDs. 5 new ways to add more to Google Wallet. Jason's Pixel 7a review. The Motorola Razr Plus' new cover screen is a big deal. Motorola Razr+ outer display is a game changer – here's everything it can do. Google Assistant is killing support for notes and lists integration with third-party apps. You can now set up the Google Tasks Assistant migration. New Google Weather looks to be a standalone app, integrate with Google Clock. @MishaalRahman: Instead of a standalone app you interact with, though, I think this new app could *just* be a location-based weather provider for not just the Clock app but potentially other Google apps down the road. Google starts rolling out image generation in Slides, more Duet AI for Gmail and Docs. Messages Magic Compose beta starts rolling out: RCS only, priority for Google One subs. JR's tip of the week: Raise to Answer. Struggling to find a good magnetic battery pack for Android. Unsafe volume notification feature is not good in the car. Nick's Android journey might end with an iPhone. Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/3WT8Cui Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Host: JR Raphael Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. title: AAA 631: Talkin' Developer Tools With Google - Matthew McCullough and J. Eason, Pixel loyalty problem, Gboard
description: Interview with Matthew McCullough and J. Eason: Explain your role as its evolved with Android over the years. How does your perspective with the Dev tools team compare to other teams and how you interact with Developers? What is the teams perspective on AI in regards to being part of the users experience and the dev experience? What is Studio Bot? What about how devs/companies may be wary of using Studio Bot, like how Apple and Samsung have banned devs from using ChatGPT? Cynical developers might be resistant to this. What's your take on that? What is developer reaction to the AI integration inside of Android Studio? Have you felt a change in interest or engagement with developers and partners as a whole in relation to larger form factors? What has been added to the OS, apis etc that devs can use to build better apps for foldable devices? - What kinds of features are devs NOT integrating for large screens, and they should! Can you comment on what "Modern Android" means to the team and how are you prioritizing new features and capabilities with "fixing" issues? What are your favorites Android 14 features? Google Is Spared a Search-Engine Switch by a Major Partner. Google Pixel owners are seemingly more likely to switch brands, and it's not hard to see why. Google's Smartphone Loyalty Problem. Gboard for Android preps an easier way to 'Resize'. JR's tip of the week: AppSales. @MishaalRahman: Android 14 prepares to let you save an 'app pair' that launches side-by-side in split-screen mode! @MishaalRahman: Hands-on: I finally got this fully working, so here's a full demo of Android 14's new partial screen recording feature. @MishaalRahman: If you connect a physical keyboard to a large screen device running Android 14, under Settings > System > Keyboard > Physical keyboard, the "keyboard shortcuts" menu will now show a MUCH more comprehensive list of available keyboard shortcuts, as shown below! @MishaalRahman: This feature is indeed live in Android 14 Beta 2! User Nick Cipriani shared this image from their Pixel. Oddly, they received this message while playing audio from their Bluetooth speaker and not headphones. @Nail_Sadykov: Looks like Android 14 will finally let you use system navigation while you're dragging & drop items. That is, you can take a photo or text from one app, open another app and drop it there. QUICK preview of the OnePlus Pad and Pixel 7a. Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/3BQaoTc Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Hosts: Mishaal Rahman and JR Raphael Guests: Matthew McCullough and Jamal Eason Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit Sponsors: fastmail.com/twit CDW.com/HPE
author: TWiT

title: AAA 630: IO23: This Is The Way - Artificial Intelligence everywhere, Pixel Tablet/Fold/7a, Project Starline
description: How was IO 2023 as an event this year? Google finally demos generative AI in Search, with a waitlist starting today. Introducing PaLM 2. Android Studio @ I/O '23: Announcing Studio Bot, an AI-powered coding assistant. How Gmail's New AI Feature Will Write Your Emails for You. Google's Magic Compose can rewrite your texts using AI. New ways AI is making Maps more immersive. Magic Editor in Google Photos: New AI editing features for reimagining your photos. Android's new generative AI can reply to your texts and design its own wallpaper. The Curious Case of the Missing Google Assistant. 16 ways that Android 14 will subtly improve your phone. Google's Project Starline Is an Ambitious Cure to My Remote Worker Loneliness. Pixel 7a. Google's Pixel 7a Is Just as Good as the Regular Pixel 7. Pixel Tablet. Pixel Fold. @Captain2Phones: Pixel Fold *can* fold flat (or nearly flat). But you need to really bend it to get it there – too much for comfort. JR's tip of the week: Niagara Launcher. Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/3od8QiX Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Host: JR Raphael Guest: Michael Wolfson Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. author: TWiT

title: AAA 629: The Password Paradigm - Google IO preview, Passkeys launch, Finder Network, Magic Compose, Google TV
description: Google IO preview! Google passkeys are a no-brainer. You've turned them on, right? The beginning of the end of the password. Apple and Google team up to bring AirTag-like unwanted tracking alerts to all item trackers on iPhone and Android. Android's 'Finder Network' should support some existing Bluetooth trackers. Google TV update rolling out with performance boost, frees up storage with app hibernation. Improvements to your Google TV Experience. Android update fixes a vulnerability that lets system apps be downgraded beyond the factory version. Improving Consistency of Background Work on Android. @MishaalRahman: Google's working to bring Material Design to Android Automotive OS, but unlike on phones, colors will be chosen by the OEM instead of derived by an algorithm. @MishaalRahman: Following the Bluetooth, WiFi, and UWB stacks, Google will next turn Android's NFC stack into a modular system component, i.e. a Project Mainline module! Tutorial: How to stop apps like Authy, Venmo, etc., from being locked to portrait mode on Android tablets/foldables. Gmail is adding a blue checkmark to better verify senders. Google Messages 'Magic Compose' AI can reply to friends – or write them a song. @MishaalRahman: According to a few users on Telegram, the Google Play Store is starting to show ads for apps in the search screen. Is anyone else seeing this? JR's tip of the week: Notification alerts! Notification Light - aodNotify. Missed call reminder, Flash on. Another viewer's tablet journey. Why not use a phone as a hotspot to drive the tablet in the car? Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/42JjzjM Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Hosts: Mishaal Rahman and JR Raphael Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit Sponsor: joindeleteme.com/twit promo code TWIT
author: TWiT

title: AAA 628: Quantifiable Badness - Google IO schedule, tracker stalking, OnePlus Pad, YouTube Music podcasts
description: - Google IO schedule is out! - Google shares I/O 2023 session list, including What's new in Android, Material Design, and gen AI. - Apple, Google team up to tackle Bluetooth tracker-stalking terror. - Google says Android will separate notification and ringtone volume. - The OnePlus Pad is an impressive tablet for its price. - OnePlus Pad Is a Promising First Tablet That Won't Break the Bank. - OnePlus Pad hands-on: I did not know they still made displays this bad. - Motorola is finally bringing a real flagship contender to the US. - The 2023 Moto G features good looks, sweet $250 price tag. - The Google Pixel Fold looks nearly gapless in first leaked marketing images. - One WhatsApp account, now across multiple phones. - Google on why Authenticator sync isn't E2E encrypted, but option coming later. - YouTube Music officially launching podcasts in the US on Android, iOS, and web. - JR's tip of the week: Pixel Search. - Can I cast my phone's screen to my tablet in the car? - An Android fan shares his tablet experience. - Smart Lock issues on Samsung devices can be fixed temporarily. Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/42jPOWQ Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Guest: JR Raphael Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit
author: TWiT

title: AAA 627: A Bounty of Bezels - Google Authenticator Cloud Sync, BMW Digital Car Key Plus, Motorola Razr Foldable
description: Google Authenticator finally, mercifully adds account syncing for two-factor codes. BMW brings digital car key support to Android with support for Pixel and Samsung. Android now has a smart solution for crashing apps. Kuba leaks the Pixel Fold. More Google Pixel Fold Specs Leak: It Seems Like a Real Contender For Samsung's Galaxy Z Fold. Google Pixel Tablet pricing starts to leak out. Google's Expensive Pixel Tablet Dock Leaks on Amazon. Motorola officially teases new Razr foldable. Motorola Razr's outer display will measure 3.5 inches as the official teaser comes out. Motorola set to launch two foldables, including the cheaper 'Razr Lite'. OnePlus' first tablet will cost $479. Upcoming Reddit changes may spell the end of free third-party apps. Decentralized Twitter competitor 'Bluesky' now has an Android app. Winamp is coming to Android, but it's not what you think. Flashback: After Over 15 Years Of Service, Winamp Will Cease To Be Available For Download Starting December 20th. JR's tip of the week: JR's final YouTube tips video. Looking for a DUMB smartphone. Has Samsung fixed the Exynos vulnerability yet? Why is Smart Lock not working anymore? Read our show notes here: https://bit.ly/3L2OHDM Hosts: Jason Howell, Ron Richards, and Huyen Tue Dao Co-Host: JR Raphael Subscribe to All About Android at https://twit.tv/shows/all-about-android. Meanwhile, Microsoft surprised basically everybody in the world by announcing an Android smartphone...coming in 2020, but still, Adam, Jonathan and Joe are excited! description: The Huawei Mate 30 Pro is one of the most gorgeous pieces of hardware to ever come out of the Chinese OEM, or any OEM for that matter. It has stunning hardware, a wonderful camera that works brilliantly in low light. But it’s missing the one thing that every phone needs to succeed - the brains. No Google. No Google Play. No apps. No good. But is the phone great enough to stand up without the apps we all want so much? Ryan Thomas-Shaw joins Adam and Jonathan to talk about it. title: Huawei P30 Pro Podcast Review: All our problems are solved
description: The Huawei P30 and P30 Pro solve a lot of problems that smartphones typically have. They can’t zoom. They can’t take good photos in low light. They don’t last more than a day. The P30 Pro removes all of those problems, and tacks on some gorgeous design besides. Our reviewer David Imel (and a flock of birds) break it all down for you from sunny Morocco! Recorded April 3, 2019 Special Guest appearance by: David Imel - @DurvidImel Topics: Huawei P30 Review: A phone with superpowers Huawei P30 Pro vs Pixel 3 XL: The ultimate low-light camera comparison Huawei P30 cameras: All the new tech explained The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: The Huawei P30 Pro puts the P in Photography
description: The Huawei P30 Pro is out and it’s bringing 5x optical zoom with a new periscope style camera. It’s an awesome new innovation in smartphone camera tech, and Adam, Joe, and Jonathan are a little in love with it. But can it beat the 2019 flagship king, the Galaxy S10 Plus? Don’t be so sure. Oppo has a weird, but cool looking popup selfie concept coming, and Razer may yet make a third generation of its phone, but not just yet. Recorded March 28, 2019 Time codes 4:40 - Huawei P30 and P30 Pro announced: The new cameras to beat in 2019? Huawei P30 and P30 Pro hands-on: Zooming into the future 12:30 - Huawei P30 cameras: All the new tech explained 20:45 - Huawei P30 Pro vs Samsung Galaxy S10 Plus: Shots fired 34:00 - See the Oppo Reno’s shark fin-style pop-up camera in this GIF 41:50 - Razer CEO hints that 5G might be the reason for Razer Phone 3 delay The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Stadia as she goes
description: Adam, Joe and Jonathan get into a long discussion about Google’s cloud-based gaming platform, Stadia. There’s a ton to digest there, and they dig deep into the details. Plus, we look back at WearOS and wonder why a five-year old platform still has so many bugs. And ZTE is gunning for the craziest phone design of the year with two solid entries! Recorded March 21, 2019 Time codes 3:25 - Google Stadia takes on the gaming industry – everything you need to know Google Stadia controller pays homage to gaming lore with its Konami Code Easter egg Questions I’d like answered before I hype Google Stadia 36:10 - Five years of Wear OS and it’s still too messy to recommend 52:30 - ZTE Axon S, Axon V offer the weirdest solutions to the notch yet The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: The Galaxy s10e, the Motorola RAZR, and the other leftovers
description: We had a huge week, which included two other podcasts.  So this podcast focuses on what’s left in the news, which is still huge! We’ve got our Samsung Galaxy S10e review, leaked specifications for the Motorola RAZR, and a new concept phone from Vivo. Plus, things are not looking good for Google’s tablet/laptop division. This is the third podcast of the week, so join us for the leftovers! Recorded March 14, 2019 Time codes 3:30 - Samsung Galaxy S10e review: The best Galaxy S10 for most people 18:30 - Motorola’s rumored Razr foldable phone might not be the flagship beast you hoped for 31:10 - Google reportedly shifting employees away from tablet, laptop division 47:00 - Vivo Apex 2019 Concept hands-on: No buttons, no ports! The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: There’s no one like Q
description: It’s Pi Day and we’re celebrating by saying goodbye to Android Pie. Too ironic? The first beta for  Android Q is available and we’re breaking down all the new features coming to your favorite operating system. New notifications, new features, new theming. It’s all here! Recorded March 14, 2019 Stories covered There are six Android Q beta versions on Google’s Q timeline Google announces first Android Q beta, available today for Pixel smartphones With Android Q, the sharing menu doesn’t suck as much Everything new in the first Android Q developer preview Android Q forces you to swipe right (to clear notifications) Android Q’s ‘Notification Bell’ helps you find what’s new in your sea of notifs Android Q makes Wi-Fi sharing easier with QR codes The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Nokia 9 PureView Podcast Review
description: The Nokia 9 PureView is here, and Eric Zeman comes aboard to give us all of his thoughts. Nokia’s innovative pentacamera setup, along with the “PureView” branding is sure to give us the best photos we’ve ever seen from a camera...right? HMD Global’s latest flagship phone is all we’re talking about here on the Nokia 9 PureView Podcast Review! Recorded March 12, 2019 Topics covered Nokia 9 PureView review: HMD Global’s best effort falls frustratingly short Nokia 9 PureView hands-on: Five cameras aim for mobile magic Nokia 9 PureView: Where to buy, when, and for how much The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Special Guest Appearance by: Eric Zeman - @zeman_e Produced by Adam Doud

title: Samsung and Huawei go 10 rounds featuring Tnkgrl, Myriam Joire from the Mobile Tech Podcast
description: Myriam Joire a.k.a. Tnkgrl from the Mobile Tech podcast joins Adam and Joe to talk all things tech from the last week. Samsung and Huawei are throwing shade at each other over their folding phone designs, and Corning wants to help by developing folding glass. Sony reveals why its smartphone cameras haven’t been great thus far (and why that’s changing). The tech industry makes some predictions on how 5G will change our lives, and Google Duplex will book your appointments for you. Recorded March 7, 2018 Time codes 1:55 - Here’s why Galaxy Fold design is better than Mate X, according to Samsung executive 11:45 - Corning is developing foldable Gorilla Glass, obviously 19:50 - Sony reveals why its smartphone cameras have lagged behind competition 33:05 - What the tech industry thinks 5G will do for us 50:00 - Google Duplex now available in 43 states, coming to non-Pixel devices soon The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Special Guest appearance by: Myriam Joire - @tnkgrl Produced by Adam Doud

title: Beyond Barcelona
description: Never underestimate the amount of news that can pour out of one trade show. Now that we’ve finished our MWC 2019 podcast, we catch you up with news from outside of Barcelona. Motorola’s folding phone is coming soon as are physical Google Assistant buttons. Speaking of Google, we suspect we’ll see the Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL Lite sooner rather than later. Tech We Like: Moshi Porto Q 5K Portable Battery Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. title: MWC 2019 Wrap up
description: Going to MWC can be quite overwhelming, but fortunately, our crack team on the ground kept the content coming, giving Adam, Jonathan, and Joe plenty to talk about. We start off by talking about the most ridiculously awesome device that was at the show, and it didn’t come from Huawei or Nokia. Even so, we talked about the Huawei Mate X and the Nokia Pureview 9. Plus we cover the Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 5G and the Sony Xperia 1. It’s a jam-packed show for you! Tech We Like: Moshi Porto Q 5K Portable Battery Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. Recorded February 28, 2019 Time codes 2:15 - The best phones of MWC 2019 4:10 - This smartphone has an 18,000mAh battery, looks dangerously heavy 15:45 - Meet the Huawei Mate X, a $2,600 foldable powerhouse 30:45 - Nokia 9 PureView hands-on: Five cameras aim for mobile magic 37:15 - LG G8 ThinQ hands-on: Bland on the outside, blistering on the inside 45:30 - Xiaomi announces Mi Mix 3 5G: Snapdragon 855, 5G connectivity for 599 euros 51:15 - Sony Xperia 1, 10, and 10 Plus hands-on: embracing the super tall display The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Samsung Galaxy S10 Podcast Review
description: To get a better idea of just what the Samsung Galaxy S10 has to offer, Adam and Joe sit down with David Imel, the chief reviewer of Android Authority. David takes us on a tour of not only the Galaxy S10, but everything that Samsung brought to its Unpacked event. We go into all the details, so pull up a chair and strap in. Recorded February 21, 2019 Topics covered Samsung Galaxy S10, S10 Plus, S10e, and S10 5G are here! Samsung Galaxy S10 hands-on: Samsung’s latest flagships set a new bar Samsung Galaxy S10 price, release date, and availability The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Samsung brings you into the fold
description: Give it up for the Galaxy Fold! Samsung’s exciting new foldable device is here, and Adam and Joe are arguing about it. Plus, they look at Samsung’s new wearables. Xiaomi released a new flagship MI 9 on the same day as Samsung. Joe wrote the big book of smartphone first that covers everything from touch screens to WiFi 6. Finally, we mourn the imminent death of the back button. Recorded February 21, 2019 Time codes 02:00 - Samsung Galaxy Fold specs: Samsung’s foldable is formidable 35:20 - Samsung announces the Galaxy Watch Active and Galaxy Fit fitness tracker 42:30 - Xiaomi Mi 9 hands-on: Flashy, not fussy 52:15 - Android Authority’s big book of smartphone firsts! 1:06:30 - Android Q gestures might rely only on pill icon, no back button The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: BB-8 is getting all Misty featuring Jonathan Strickland from Tech Stuff
description: You may have heard of Sphero. You may have heard of Star Wars. Adam looked at all the robots he could find. But one robot maker had a great product, a great plan, and a great story to along with it. It’s like a trifecta of awesome. We’ve got droids, we got a passionate developer community, and we have a company that’s here for the long haul. But, since this is a special podcast, we needed a special guest to unpack it all. Joining Adam and Joe, is Jonathan Strickland from the Tech Stuff podcast. Jonathan has been podcasting about technology for over 10 years and 1,000 episodes, so it was only appropriate to bring him on to talk Misty II, the ultimate developer’s robot! This is Part 1 of a two-part episode. Part 2 is located on the Tech Stuff channel. Go check it out, and subscribe to one of the best tech podcasts on the internet! Very special guest appearance Jonathan Strickland, Executive Producer/Host, HowStuffWorks Interview guests Ian Bernstein, Founder, Head of Product, Misty Robotics Tim Enwall, Head of Misty Robotics Stuart Lipoff, Vice President for Publications, IEEE Consumer Electronics Society The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Looking ahead to MWC 2019
description: Up until now, we’ve only seen mid-tier phones. But that’s all about to change with MWC right around the corner. Plus, AT&T is trying to con everyone, and Sprint ain’t having it. OnePlus is killing it in the US and in Barcelona, and finally we take a look at all the features you need to have in a smartphone. Tech We Like: Plugable Performance Studio-Grade USB Microphone Cardioid Condenser Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. title: Nokia and Google Nostalgia
description: Never seen a Nokia-made, android powered phone in the States? That’s about to change! Also, Adam, Jonathan, and Joe take a look at three new Moto G7 phones. Plus, we look back at the top 50 products that Google has made...and killed. Which fitness tracker should you buy? And finally we have an answer in the 1080p vs 1440p battery consumption debate! The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. Recorded February 7, 2019 Time codes 1:30 - Motorola Moto G7 series hands-on: A fine family 12:40 - Nokia 3.1 Plus review: A return to form for a beloved brand 22:10 - 1080p vs 1440p: How much does 1440p really affect battery life? 31:40 - Fitbit Versa vs Apple Watch Series 4: Which smartwatch is right for you? 38:25 - We ranked 50 failed Google products from best to worst The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: U.S. vs. Huawei: It's getting real
description: Going into February, things are becoming more clear in the United States versus Huawei fight, and the tide may be turning. China is trying to help Huawei however it can. At the same time, Meizu is crowdfunding a buttonless and portless phone, and we’re not thrilled about it. And Gary Explains...explains just how much RAM your smartphone needs these days. Recorded January 31, 2019 Time codes 1:55 - Huawei is facing a 13-count indictment including bank fraud by the U.S. Huawei indicted, China responds. Should consumers worry? Huawei’s problems are China’s problems, and the country is now reacting 30:00 - Want a phone with no ports or proper buttons? That’ll be $1,300, please Portless phones: Dumb gimmick or inevitable future? 42:25 - Gary Explains: How much RAM does your phone REALLY need in 2019? The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Honor View 20 podcast review
description: To fully appreciate the Honor View 20, you need to start on the back, because it is gorgeous. However, the Honor View 20 is more than just a pretty face. To tell you all about it, we brought on our reviewer, Lanh Nguyen. Is this the best flagship of 2019? Absolutely...well so far anyway. But this phone checks a lot of boxes. Come check it out with us! Recorded January 28, 2019 Topics covered Honor View 20 review: A hole-in-one! Honor View 20 specs: What’s Honor’s new flagship packing? Specs comparison: Honor View 20 vs Honor View 10 Honor View 20 with Kirin 980 and 48MP camera launches in Europe starting at 569 euros The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With Special Guest Appearance by: Lanh Nguyen - @LanhNguyenFilms Produced by Adam Doud

title: Google Play has a problem
description: Let us regale to you the tale of the startup that deregistered a user’s wi-fi connected garage door because of a bad review. The Google Play store has a clone problem it can’t seem to solve. Xiaomi doubles down on the folding phone concept, and we find out if a Chromebook can replace your everyday laptop. Tech We Like: DJI Osmo Pocket Handheld 3 Axis Gimbal Stabilizer Visit http://tyvm.ly/iDOmd Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. Recorded January 24, 2019 at 8:30PM Time codes 5:30 - Xiaomi reveals foldable phone prototype: Is this the cheap one we’ve been waiting for?(subscribe to the DGiT Daily!) 20:40 - Google Play still has a clone problem in 2019 with no end in sight 34:15 - Is it dumb that everything is “smart?” 49:00 - One-month test: Can a Chromebook replace my main computer? The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Getting the Royole Treatment: An interview with Bill Liu, CEO of Royole
description: You may have heard of Royole, maker of the world’s first (and as of publication, only) folding phone, the FlexPai. Adam puts on his interviewer hat and sits down with Bill Liu, CEO of Royole to talk about flexible phones, the importance of being first, and what the future holds for Royole and the Flexpai. Joe and Jonathan join Adam throughout the interview to discuss. Interview on 1/10/2019Recorded on 1/22/2019 Topics covered If your phone has an OLED display, Samsung likely made its screen Royole FlexPai Hands-on with the world’s first foldable smartphone Royole FlexPai – everything you need to know about the first foldable phone The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Google Pixel 3 Lite revealed?
description: Down in Las Vegas, Gary Sims took the Snapdragon 855 processor for a spin at CES and the results are impressive. Motorola is hoping you’ll flip for its new flip phone. We get an early look at a potential new midrange form from Google mere months before it’s announced. Google might be granting a long-requested wish for its fans. All that and more on the Android Authority podcast! Recorded January 17, 7:30PM CST Time codes 4:20 - Snapdragon 855 performance and benchmarking: Speed Test G, AnTuTu & Geekbench 21:45 - You’ll flip for the foldable Motorola Razr smartphone reboot 34:40 - Google Pixel 3 Lite leaks in video review: Should you expect flagship photo quality? 44:20 - Yes, there is a system-wide dark theme in this early Android Q build The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: CES 2019 - All your favorite people
description: For our last CES 2019 episode, we take 5 minutes to talk to some of the faces of CES that make this space so great to work in. Hear from Myriam Joire, Juan Carlos Bagnell, Trisha Hershberger, Jules Wang, Jaime Rivera, Jon Rettinger, C. Scott Brown, and Jonathan Feist. Oh, and there’s one more person you won’t want to miss. Recorded at CES 2019 The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: CES 2019 Wrap up, featuring Michael Fisher of TheMrMobile/Mobile Nations
description: Wrapping up a long week of technology and innovation can be hard to do in one podcast, so Adam and Jonathan are joined by Michael Fisher, a.k.a. @TheMrMobile. We broadcasted from the Blue Podcast Studio suite at Treasure Island with some sweet Blue gear and we discussed the week of tech that was. Recorded January 10, 2019 5:00 PM PST Topics covered: Android Authority’s CES Top Picks 2019 Awards: Our favorite products from the show The Printbrush Fluidity Remote (as described in Dronerush’s Best Drones of CES Awards) Nubia X looks stunning with smartly-integrated secondary display Alcatel’s 1C and 1X hands-on: Budget as budget gets Hisense U30 quietly lands at CES: Yet another 48MP phone with punch-hole camera Dell Alienware Area-51m (as described in our Best Laptops of CES 2019 video) Google Assistant Connect makes it easier for companies to create smart products The DJI Osmo Pocket is a great drone camera Why Royole is the company to watch in 2019 The robots of CES 2019 Special Guest appearance by: Michael Fisher - @themrmobile The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: CES 2019 Special: Samsung’s Press Conference with Daniel Bader of Android Central
description: Samsung’s press conference brought us a number of goodies at its press conference yesterday. Adam sat down with Daniel Bader, Managing Editor of Android Central to talk about everything we saw in this special CES edition of the Android Authority podcast. Samsung smart TVs get iTunes movies and TV shows, Airplay 2 support Recorded January 07, 2019 at 3:30pm Special Guest appearance by: Daniel Bader - @JourneyDan The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: CES 2019 Preview!
description: Guest host C. Scott Brown and Adam discuss CES 2019 - first experiences, and what we’ll see...probably. We also caught some OEMs trying to cheat on Benchmark scores and we call them out! Plus, Apple had a really bad day and we wonder what it means for the rest of the industry. Tech We Like: Skipped on Shuffle Podcast Recorded Jan 3, 2019 7:30PM Time codes 10:05 – CES 2019: what to expect 42:35 – Phones we caught cheating benchmarks in 2018 52:25 - Apple cuts revenue estimates, blames weak iPhone sales, cheap battery replacements The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Special Guest appearance by: Scott Brown - @c_scottbrown Produced by Adam Doud

title: Live podcast Q&A: So Long, 2018!
description: We recorded a live podcast on December 27th, on our Android Authority YouTube channel, and took questions from the viewers, which tied in nicely with the news of the week. We look at the Galaxy S9 and it’s One UI/Android Pie update. We look at 2018, and how it set the stage for the year to come. The Google Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL are coming. All that plus a lot of great questions from those who chimed in. It was a casual end-of-year podcast. And a bonus fun link we discussed on the show! "APPLE PRODUCT LAUNCH" — A Bad Lip Reading h/t Bad Lip Reading Recorded December 27, 2018 8:00PM ET Time codes 06:15 - Stable Android Pie with One UI is now rolling out to Samsung Galaxy S9/S9 Plus! 09:00 - Android in 2018 is the opening act for Android in 2019 15:00 - Huawei and ZTE may face new US ban via White House executive order 20:20 - Google Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL Lite tipped to land on Verizon this Spring The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRushcom Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Looking back on 2018 - Huawei, Lenovo, and more
description: The end of 2018 is here, and we want to know what you this. Please fill out our survey and let us know what you think! We also take a look at the best apps and games of 2018, as judged by our own Joe Hindy. Also, not to be overlooked (again) we look at some of the best phones in 2018 that maybe didn’t get the love they deserved. And speaking of overlooked, our review of the Huawei Mate 20 is in - a great phone with a greater big brother. Tech We Like: The Soundguys Podcast: It’s beginning to sound a lot like Christmas. Recorded December 20, 2018 7:30pm Time codes 2:20 - The Android Authority year-end survey: Help us become better! 3:30 - 15 best Android apps released in 2018!   20:10 - 15 best Android games released in 2018! 28:50 - The most underrated smartphones of 2018 35:10 - Lenovo Z5 Pro GT has outrageous 12GB of RAM, Snapdragon 855, sliding back  40:50 - Huawei Mate 20 review: Packing premium performance for a high price The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: OnePlus 6T McLaren, Start Your Engines
description: Vitaminwater wants to know if you can ditch your phone for a year and it willing to pay $100,000 to find out We go hands-on the OnePlus 6T McLaren edition - the fastest phone out there? The Honor View 20 and the Samsung Galaxy A8s are here to start the screen hole revolution A new leak gives us a lot of detail about the upcoming Samsung Galaxy S10 We take a look at the Vivo Nex Dual Display Edition with a second screen on the back. title: Gary Explains: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 855 processor
description: Qualcomm’s latest flagship SoC is out, and we’re breaking it down here. But processors are complicated, so we got the smartest guy we know to come on an explain everything to us in the awesomest way possible. Discussed in this episode: Qualcomm reveals Snapdragon 855, even more 5G plans at its Tech Summit Top 5 Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 features you should know Qualcomm announces the world’s first 3D ultrasonic in-display fingerprint sensor Qualcomm Snapdragon 855 vs Exynos 9820 vs Kirin 980 Don’t forget to check out Gary’s Speed Test G! The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With special guest: Gary Sims - @GarySims / @GaryExplains Produced by Adam Doud

title: Huawei's Arrested Development
description: Qualcomm introduced us to the SoC that will power your smartphone next year. Huawei’s CTO has the right to remain silent, eh? Samsung’s mobile division is in a bit of trouble with a huge drop in sales YoY. We are enamored with the dual-screened Vivo Nex 2, but aren’t sure why. In a notification showdown, Android still comes out on top. Google is shutting down two of its seven messaging apps, because: Google. title: The Best of Android, the Best of Google
description: Our Readers Choice Award is in and it should come as no surprise. We also look at the best innovation of 2018, as voted on by the Android Authority staff. Our official review of the Google Pixel Slate is in, so we look at the best Chrome tablet you can buy, with help from Lanh Nguyen. Google Fi is official and comes with support for more phones 25 years ago, AT&T made some predictions, and holy cow were they accurate. title: DGiT Daily - November 30, 2018 -  Down goes Daredevil
description: Thanks again, Android Authority crowd, for letting us butt in. Your normal programming will return next week. But if you like us, subscribe! This is your last chance to win a Pixel 3 XL! Another one bites the dust. Netflix has cancelled its original Marvel tv series, DareDevil, and speculation is that Disney is just consolidating its properties in advance of its own streaming service, but...is it? Our roundup features stories about the Microsoft roadmap, the new Sirin Finney blockchain phone, Google Assistant’s new manners, worldwide Chinese internet, watching porn at Starbucks, and AT&T predicting the future. www.dgit.com@DgitDaily

title: DGiT Daily - November 29, 2018 - Google Fi cometh
description: Don’t forget to try to win a Pixel 3 XL courtesy of...us! Google Fi is now an official MVNO which you can sign up for today. It expanded its support phone options, but does it make sense for the average consumer? Your mileage may vary. Our roundup features stories about the notch replacement a.k.a the hole, the popularity of the iPhone XR, a case to not buy a launch-day Pixel phone, equipping soldiers with AR, DJI’s new camera/gimbal, the FTC’s investigation of loot boxes and child gambling. www.dgit.com@DgitDaily

title: DGiT Daily - November 27, 2018 - Touchdown!
description: NASA successfully landed on the moon resulting in one of the most awesome handshakes ever seen on YouTube. Also, we learn about holes upcoming in phone screens - and it’s not all that great. Our roundup features stories about new tariffs on phones coming into the US and thanks 45, choosing between Google and Alexa, the state of technology in 2018, Microsoft and Apple’s struggle atop the market cap hill, Japan’s rising vacant housing crisis, and National Geographic’s top 100 photos of the year - they’re seriously great. Subscribe to the DGiT Daily Podcast! www.dgit.com @DgitDaily

title: DGiT Daily - November 26, 2018 - Get your a** to Mars
description: Your top story of the day - NASA is landing a new spacecraft on the surface of Mars, and you can live stream the seven minutes of terror on YouTube today at 3:00PM ET. Android Authority, CNET, and Amazon (natch) all have awesome Cyber Monday hubs for you to check out Our roundup features stories about LG’s 16 camera phone patent, Apple’s day in court, Tesla’s brush with death, jaywalking in China, an airplane with no moving parts, and the most amazing things in the universe. Subscribe to the DGiT Daily podcast on Pocketcasts! www.dgit.com@DgitDaily

description: We have crowned our best of Android 2018 Champion, and you won't want to miss it. Black Friday is here and the deal are a-flying. We announce a new podcast and a new standardized test for smartphones, and examine the upcoming wave of 5G phones. title: The Best of Android Awards
description: There’s a lot that goes into our best of Android awards every year, but this year we pulled out all the stops. So we wanted to take you through our process on how we decide what phone has the best screen, performance, battery life, camera, and audio, and how we go about generating an overall score. We got a ton of data on each phone, and we’re breaking it all down for you here on the podcast! title: Samsung brings the 8K video
description: Black Friday is almost here and we’ve got some great deals we’re looking forward to/. Our Skagen Flaster 2 Review is in and it’s...niche. Samsung unveiled its new Exynos processor with some nifty capabilities. Gary Sims compares processors built on the 7nm process, and we take a look at AI photography and wonder if it’s helping. description: Our best of Android tournament has begun, and you can vote for your favorites! Samsung’s phones are too tall, and now they’re fixing the UI to compensate. Google introduced native Android support for “foldables”. Samsung shows us how that’s going to work with its first foldable phone. LG is joining the folding phone party in January and we go hands on with a foldable phone you can buy today! title: OnePlus 6T Podcast Review
description: This is a featured story of the Android Authority Podcast were we take a deep dive into a single topic. Today’s topic is our OnePlus 6T review. We’ve brought in David Imel, our chief reviewer here at Android Authority for his take on OnePlus’s latest flagship. OnePlus 6T – features, specs, pricing, and everything you need to know OnePlus 6T first impressions: All about trade-offs Buy the OnePlus 6T Recorded November 5, 2018 The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With Special Guest David Imel - @DurvidImel Produced by Adam Doud

title: Huawei and Honor magic and Google Home Hub hacking
description: The OnePlus 6T is here and we’ve gone hands-on. Stand by for our podcast review next week! Spotify and Google are working together to bring you music on demand with the power of your voice. Act now to take advantage! Our official Huawei Mate 20 Pro review is live. Is this the best phone money can buy now? The Google Home Hub is your familiar Google Home but with a screen. Security vulnerabilities found in the Google Home Hub are nothing to worry about, says the creator. The Honor Magic 2 is Honor's latest offering with a screen-to-body ratio of almost 100% and six cameras on board. Along with the smartphone, Honor brought a smartwatch, tablet, and true wireless earbuds to the party. Tech We Like: Men's SCOTTeVEST Jacket Visit http://tyvm.ly/A5k3 Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. title: EU vs Google vs OEMs: Someone is getting screwed
description: Our full review of the Razer Phone 2 is in, and it’s basically what we expected it to be. The Xiaomi Mi Mix 3 is Xiaomi’s latest flagship, packing a 93.4 percent screen-to-body ratio and up to 10GB of RAM. Night Sight on the Google Pixel 3 is the answer to low-light cameras, and it’s a really, really good answer. Google will start charging for Google Play services in the EU, and OEMs will pay a lot, as it turns out. Want to make an Android phone? That’ll be two years of updates, please. The Google Pixel 3 might have some memory management issues. Suddenly 4GB of RAM doesn’t seem like a good idea. The Pixel 3 also has a great camera, but sometimes, that shot you captured wasn’t captured after all. Tech We Like: Anker Bolder LC40 LED FlashlightVisit http://tyvm.ly/k0irX Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. title: The Google Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL Podcast Review
description: Our Google Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL reviews are in, and we have Kris Carlon, Managing editor of Android Authority and our chief reviewer of the phone in house to talk all about Google's newest hardware. Find out why he calls it "The Android iPhone". And find out who Billy is. When you're done, check out our full review of the phones on androidauthority.com Recorded October 22, 2018 at 1:00pm EST The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With special guest appearance by Kris Carlon - @KrisCarlon Managing Editor, Android Authority Produced by Adam Doud

title: Mates, we have new Mates!
description: The clash between Google and the EU took another step, and maybe not for the better. Google’s event made it look a lot more like Apple and Amazon, and we discuss. The Huawei Mate 20 Pro, Mate 20, and Mate 20 X gaming phone are official. The Asus ROG phone is the gaming phone of your dreams. title: Everything you ever wanted to know about 5G (but were afraid to ask)
description: 5G is coming, and at the Motorola Z3 launch event in Chicago, Verizon was all over that 5G train. So we rounded up three experts, from Qualcomm, Motorola, and Verizon to talk about it. Then we brought in Android Authority’s resident engineering expert, Robert Triggs, to wrap it all up in a nice neat little bow for you. It’s our next featured story of the Android Authority podcast! Recorded October 17, 2018 @ 1:00pm EST Articles for further reading: What is 5G, and what can we expect from it? 5G: When will your smartphone get it? 5G hype is coming. Don’t fall for it. Forget mmWave, Wi-Fi is the real 5G Moto Z3’s Mod reveals the problem with 5G Don’t believe the carriers, the 5G revolution is still years away The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Special appearances by: Robert Triggs of @AndroidAuth Not on Twitter. Seriously. Sherif Hanna (formerly) of @Qualcomm @SherifHanna Jeff Snow of @Moto Also, not on Twitter. Chris Emmons of @Verizon @Maxxpower13 Produced by Adam Doud

title: When Three Cameras Just Won’t Do
description: We give a eulogy to Google Plus, Google’s fallen social network. 66% of our podcast will miss it quite a bit. The Razer Phone 2 is out now and it is doing a lot of things right. Samsung introduced us to the world’s first phone with four cameras on the back in the Samsung Galaxy A9. Also, Samsung might be leaving the headphone jack out of its flagships late next year. Are the headphone jack’s days (even more) numbered? Tech We Like: Logitech G910 Orion Spark RGB Mechanical Gaming Keyboard Visit http://www.andauth.co/TechWeLike Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. Recorded 10/11/18 12:45pm Time codes: 3:05 – Google+ to shut down after private user data exposed 17:30 – Razer Phone 2 specs: Familiar, but better in all the ways that matter   Razer Phone 2 hands-on: A sharp upgrade 26:50 – Samsung Galaxy A9 (2018) announced: Four rear cameras, but there is more to like 35:15 – Brace yourself: Samsung could drop the headphone jack from next year The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Google Pixel 3 launch: An event 45 days in the making
description: It’s finally here! The Google Pixel 3 is official, and to celebrate we podcasted live immediately following the event. Google introduced us to the Google Home Hub, the Pixel Slate and the Pixel 3 and Pixel 3 XL. We were joined from the show floor by Managing Editor Kris Carlon for his first impressions as well. Be sure to join the conversation using the hashtag #AAPodcast on twitter, and we’ll see you there! The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With special guest Kris Carlon - @KrisCarlon Managing Editor, Android Authority Produced by Adam Doud

title: #Phonepocalypse Now!
description: Microsoft is becoming best buds with Android, allowing you to use your phone on your computer. That’s pretty next level. We have an avalanche of phones headed your way in October - we’re breaking them all down here. Our full review of the LG V40 ThinQ is in, all five cameras and a sweet DAC. We got our first look at the Nokia 7.1 - the surprisingly awesome midranger. Finally, Google assistant got a fresh coat of paint and we like it. Tech we like - Royale RoWrite Affiliate disclosure: We may receive compensation in connection with your purchase of products via links on this page. The compensation received will never influence the content, topics or posts made on this podcast. title: Happy Birthday Google and Android!
description: Both Google and Android had birthdays this year - 20 and 10 respectively. This is a double dose of milestone birthdays and we have a lot to talk about because of it! We’ve got it all - inside tips on how to get the most out of Google’s services, a couple of throwbacks to the birth of Google and Android. It’s all here on the Android Authority Podcast! Recorded September 27, 2018 Time codes: 2:25 – Google turns 20: The 20 biggest milestones in Google’s history 12:40 – Android turns 10 today: Here are 5 features we still use from Android 1.0 17:30 – Android turns 10: Remembering the first Android phone, the T-Mobile G1 / HTC Dream 22:00 – Google Feed officially called Discover, will appear at Google.com on mobile 29:10 – From Android to YouTube: 20+ pro tips from the Googlers behind them The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

description: Google might be including their new Home Hub device in their October event, but we have a review of the JBL Link View right now. Manufacturers keep leaving out the headphone jack for no reason and new devices are leaking like a rusty faucet. This podcast is sponsored by MNML Cases. September 20, 2018 8:30PM EST Time codes: 1:45 - Google Home Hub smart display rumor 6:40 - JBL Link View review 12:10 - Bad excuses to remove the headphone jack, debunked 28:00 - OnePlus 6T render and video leak 32:05 - Razer Phone 2 leaks and rumors The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Adam Molina - @adamlukas17 Produced by Jonathan Feist on behalf of Adam Doud

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Beauty of OnePlus
description: We check in to see what Android’s main competition Apple is up to. Turns out it’s up to about 1,100 bucks. OnePlus is delighting and frustrating it customers with its upcoming OnePlus 6T. We are rapidly approaching an age where three cameras just won’t be sufficient anymore. And Google is shuttering its Inbox email client to mixed reactions. This podcast is sponsored by MNML Cases. Check out mnmlcase.com and use the promo code “AAPOD” to get 15% off you order. September 13, 2018 8:30PM EST Time codes: 1:45 - Everything Apple announced today: iPhone, iOS, Apple Watch, and more 16:00 - 6 reasons why I am incredibly excited for the OnePlus 6T 20:10 - OnePlus 6T won’t have a headphone jack 24:45 - What to expect from Google’s Pixel 3 hardware event this October 32:30 - Smartwatches can last all week with the Snapdragon Wear 3100, but there’s a catch 36:30 - Multiple lenses: The next big trend in mobile photography? 38:35 - Google is shutting down Inbox in March (if there’s time) The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Samsung knows when to fold ‘em
description: We take AI photo enhancement for a spin with the Huawei P20 Pro, the LG V35s, and the Google Pixel 2. Samsung is bringing us a folding phone, and likely this year. We discuss. Chrome 69 is Google’s 10th birthday surprise with some major enhancements. And by the way, Google wasn’t to kill URLs as well. Multiple OEMs are launching beta testing for Android Pie, and much more quickly than we expected. And finally, OnePlus looks to open a physical store in France and we’re not so sure that’s a good idea. This podcast is sponsored by MNML cases. Visit www.mnmlcase.com and use the promo code “AAPod” for 15% off your order. Recorded September 6, 2018 at 12:00pm EST Time codes: 02:00 - Does AI matter in the camera? LG V30S vs Huawei P20 Pro vs Google Pixel 2 07:25 - What we know so far about Samsung’s foldable phone Samsung CEO: First foldable phone could be unveiled in November 15:45 - Chrome celebrates 10 years with great new features in version 69, out now Google Chrome director: “Everyone is unsatisfied by URLs. They kind of suck.” 31:00 - Open Beta 1 for the OnePlus 6 brings Android 9.0 Pie EMUI 9 beta: Huawei and Honor users can now sign up to test Android Pie 34:30 - OnePlus could open a retail store in France this year The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With Special Guest: Adam Molina of the SoundGuys - @AdamLukas17 Produced by Adam Doud

title: Is Bluetooth Dangerous? NO! Part 2
description: You may be wondering - with all the headphone jacks disappearing from our phones, and Bluetooth quickly becoming more and more common - is Bluetooth dangerous? Where do we turn for answers? Google of course! But the search results of Google are littered with lies and false information; so much so that it’s hard to tell what’s true? Well, wonder no more. We’ve teamed up with our friends, the SoundGuys to learn about Bluetooth, and other forms of non-ionizing radiation. Part 1 of this podcast can be found here on the SoundGuys podcast. Take a moment to listen to the facts there, and tune in for our roundtable discussion with SoundGuys’ Chris Thomas and Adam Molina. The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With Special Guests: Chris Thomas - @CThomasTech Adam Molina - @AdamLukas17 Produced by Adam Doud

title: Wear OS Got a Brand New Coat
description: We discuss the new design of Wear OS and the usefulness of smartwatches in general. Fortnite fumbled it’s Play store-less launch much to Google’s delight, but Google was a little bit of a jerk to them because of it.It’s IFA-week so we’ve got a gaggle of device launches including the Mi Band 3, the Honor Play, and more. Plus, we take a look at Hollywood’s version of our gadget future and discuss which one we’re closest to today. Don’t forget to answer our question of the show: What 5 apps would you want notifications form on the Mi Band 3? Use the hashtags #AAPodcast and #MiBand5 Time codes: 2:15 – Huge Wear OS redesign is coming, check out how it works in these GIFs 11:10 - Fortnite’s first Android Installer had a major security flaw 22:20 - Xiaomi Mi Band 3 review 28:55 - Honor Play review: Flagship specs on a budget 34:35 - How sci-fi movies and TV shows have imagined mobile phones, smartphones and tablets The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Full Frontal Google Pixel 3 XL
description: Jonathan Feist is our friend from dronerush.com and he’s here to tell us all about the two biggest drone announcements of the year - the DJI Mavic 2 Pro and the Mavic 2 Zoom. Everything you could possibly want to know about the Google Pixel 3 XL is already out there - photos, camera samples, box contents, headphones - you name it, we know it...45 days before its announcement. We break down the five best premium apps you can buy for Android right now. And finally, we take a long look at the newly announced Fitbit Charge 3 and FitBit Pay. We thank MNML Cases for sponsoring this podcast. Visit http://www.mnmlcase.com and use the promo code: AAPod for 15% off your order. Recorded Aug 24, 2018 Noon EST Time codes: 03:10 – DJI Mavic 2 Pro and DJI Mavic 2 Zoom are official – all you need to know 15:40 – Here’s everything you could want to see of the Google Pixel 3 XL. Three links for you: https://www.androidauthority.com/google-pixel-3-xl-complete-897513/ https://www.androidauthority.com/google-pixel-3-xl-first-look-leak-897858/ https://www.androidauthority.com/google-pixel-3-xl-selfie-cameras-897959/ 29:00 – Five premium Android games worth every cent 34:20 – Fitbit Charge 3 is here: Water resistant, Fitbit Pay support, and a working SpO2 sensor The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Everything Android at IFA 2018 in Berlin
description: Android Authority is going to be at IFA 2018 in Berlin. This podcast is our roundup of what we expect to see at Internationale Funkausstellung this year, including an exclusive look at new gradient colors on the Huawei P20 Pro, two new gaming phones from Honor and ASUS, a new phone from BlackBerry - the Key2 LE, and a new phone from Nokia. We're excited about the ASUS ROG Phone, and possibly the LG V40, but we'll have to wait and see! Join us as we speculate about things to come. The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Samsung Galaxy Note 9: The Podcast Review
description: One of the biggest devices of the year is here, and our reviewer is in the studio to tell us all about it. Is the Note 9 the best smartphone money can buy? Does it earn the comma in its price tag? We brought in the reviewer of the Note 9, David Imel to tell us all about it. It's fast, it's huge, and the S Pen is awesome, but is it the best phone of 2018? David bears all on this featured story of the Android Authority podcast. The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy With special guest: David Imel - @DurvidImel Produced by Adam Doud

title: The Moto Z3 is bad for my Digital Wellbeing
description: Recorded August 16, 2018 8:30PM EST Our full review of the Moto Z3 and the Lenovo Smart Display are in, and we're ready to talk about them. Plus, Xiaomi hits us with a new phone and a new sub-brand. No one trusts Huawei and yet no one seems to know why. And finally, Android Pie is concerned about our Digital Wellbeing, and now, so are we! Time codes: 05:00 - Motorola Moto Z3 review: Is the promise of 5G enough?   11:50 - Motorola Moto Z3 vs the competition 12:30 - Lenovo Smart Display review: Much more than a Google Home 21:11 - Hands-on: Xiaomi’s Pocophone F1 takes aim at OnePlus 6 28:20 - If Huawei has a security problem, what exactly is it? 35:00 - A few days in with Digital Wellbeing, and it’s already changing my life The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: The Samsung Galaxy Note 9 unpacked!
description: Recorded August 10 1:00 ET The Samsung Galaxy Note 9 is here with a few surprises in store. The Galaxy Watch arrives with Tizen and a week of battery life. Samsung is in the smart speaker business with the Galaxy Home. Fortnite is on Android - mostly. What are the exceptions? We'll run them down here, along with an interview with Epic Games' CEO. The Pixel 3 is revealed in all its notchy glory. And finally, Adam has the definitive final word on the Palm brand revival. Time codes: 2:40 – Samsung Galaxy Note 9 hands-on: A Fortnite away 12:00 – Samsung Galaxy Watch is here: A smartwatch that ticks like an analog watch   19:00 – Samsung announces Galaxy Home smart speaker and big Bixby improvements 27:40 – Fortnite on Android first look – you might want to wait off… 31:05 – Fortnite for Android interview – Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney on breaking away from Google Play 33:15 - Google Pixel 3 XL images leak again, and this time it’s the real deal 39:25 - The upcoming Palm phone may have a teeny, tiny display The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: Android Pie - We like pie!
description: Android Pie is official - the name and the build are both hitting the OTA airwaves as we speak. Seeing as how we’re all about Android, we thought we’d talk about it a little bit. Hosts Adam Doud, Jonathan Feist, and Joe Hindy all discuss the latest update to Android, and the OEM who also released an Android Pie upgrade on day 1! We discuss new features and improvements, updates, and a few things Google removed which leave us scratching our heads. All this and more! The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

title: The Moto Z3, Apple, and Fortnite all take a big number two
description: Recorded August 3 2:00 ET Adam went to the launch of the Moto Z3 and Verizon’s 5G network - hear his unfiltered hands on look at Moto’s new phone. Huawei knocked out Apple as the number two smartphone seller in the world, but we have to wonder if those numbers are fudged just a bit. Samsung releasing the Galaxy Note 9 early might be just what it needs to perk up slower sales. Sony still can’t sell a phone to save its soul. And finally, we take a look at how Epic Games is handling its Fortnite distribution on Android. Spoiler alert, two of the three of us think it sucks. title: Android P and the Google Assistant Showdown!
description: Recorded July 26 8:00 ET Android P’s final beta has hit the airwaves, and Pixels and Nexi are downloading furiously. What does this mean? We’re that much closer to finding out the elusive Android P name - oh and gesture navigation too. Android O has taken the world by storm - doubling its install base to...10%. This is actually really good news for Android and Android users and we explain why. In an assistant showdown, Google Assistant reigned supreme in every category except one - and that one is a little weird given what we know about Android and Google. The Google Pixel has one of the best cameras on the market today, and one of our editors is calling for a better camera app to match. Spoiler alert - not all of use agree that it’s necessary. And finally, we take an exclusive peek at a new midrange HTC phone. Could this be the HTC U12 Life? It’s very possible and it’s rumored to come at an attractive price too. All this and more this week on the Android Authority podcast! Time codes: 01:20 - Android P Beta 4 is here, so the stable version of Android P is next! 06:55 - Android version distribution: Oreo installations more than doubled in 2 months 16:00 - Report: Google Assistant is better than Siri in every tested category – except one   28:25 - The Pixel 3 needs an updated Google Camera app 33:25 - Exclusive: Specs blowout for unannounced HTC smartphone codenamed “Imagine Life” Phones we didn’t get a chance to talk about Xiaomi Mi A2, Xiaomi Mi A2 vs Nokia 6, Honor 7s The Android Authority podcast is: Adam Doud - @DeadTechnology Jonathan Feist - @JFeist1 / @DroneRush Joe Hindy - @ThatJoeHindy Produced by Adam Doud

Plus, Android Authority readers are all stuck on a phone from the past. Plus, as much as Adam loves the Axon M, another OEM almost beat ZTE to the punch - none other than Samsung. Plus, we look at AT&T’s new cord-cutting TV service and how it’s already leveraging the Time Warner merger. title: Featured Story - Samsung Galaxy Note 9 Rumor roundup
description: Recorded July 8, 2018 One of the biggest devices of the year is just a few weeks away. Is the Note a spec bump, or is it the big beefy powerhouse you’ll want in your pocket? All of that will be covered in this featured story of the Android Authority Podcast. The Android Authority podcast is the weekly podcast where we look at all the top stories from the past seven days and drill down into the details. But in this episode, we are doing something different. This is a different kind of podcast episode which we are calling a featured story. A featured story is where we take a deep dive into one topic. This will be a bonus episode that we’ll do an undetermined number of times, but probably at least once per month. Perhaps it will be interviews with industry leaders. Maybe it will be a review of a device that was just released. This time, it’s a rumor roundup of one of the biggest devices of the year, the Note 9. Here's our article about it. It is a very busy time around the Android Authority network, be sure to check in with DGiT.com, Drone Rush, and SoundGuys.com (also check out their podcast) for some of the latest from our team. title: The Android Authority Podcast is back!
description: The Android Authority Podcast is back, bringing you all the top stories of the past seven days. Hosts Adam Doud, Jonathan Feist, and Joe Hindy will give you the news, opinions, and commentary every Friday. Plus, we'll be bringing you bonus episodes with our featured stories. These episodes will take a deep dive into a single topic that needs a bit more love. From interviews with industry insiders to flagship phone releases, our featured stories will give you an in depth look at the topics that matter most. All this and more on the re-released Android Authority podcast!

title: Podcast Final - AAP/FDP #115
description: Joshua Vergara, Joe Hindy, Jonathan Feist, Lanh Nguyen, Nirave Gondhia, David Imel and Adam Molina are on deck for the final AA Podcast. We have nothing but gratitude for everyone that joined us for the run. We leave you with knowledge: Dr. Hindyana Jones, Jr., often shortened to "Hindy", is a main character of the Android Authority franchise. George Lucas created the character in homage to the gaming heroes of 1980s. The character first appeared in the 2011 film Raiders of the Lost XDA Developer, to be followed by Hindyana Jones and the Temple of Lifehacks in 2013, ultimately finishing the trilogy with Hindyana Jones and the Kingdom of Android Authority. The character is also featured in articles, podcasts and other media. It is a very busy time around the Android Authority network, be sure to check in with DroneRush.com, VRSource.com, SoundGuys.com and of course, AndroidAuthority.com for some of the latest from our team. With Jonathan Feist out with car troubles, the rest of the gang gets together to talk about the OnePlus 5 that was just reviewed and covered extensively at Android Authority. title: MWC 2017 | Podcast special
description: Watch the show on YouTube here:  Joshua Vergara is in Barcelona, Spain. Admittedly, a good group from Android Authority is in Barcelona for MWC 2017, the biggest mobile show of the year. In this special episode of the Android Authority podcast, Josh hangs out independently with Nicole Scott (@nicole_scooter) of Mobile Geeks, she thinks the LG G6 is the winner of the show! Next up, Juan Carlos Bagnell (@SomeGadgetGuy) of Pocketnow, with his infectious personality, laughs along with Josh. Tablets and laptops join the conversation, as does the Samsung S Pen and wearables. The talk mostly stays on a high level, talking about how people see the various devices and what it's like to attend these fun tech shows. Not to mention that LG G6 screen corner situation. Last up, as both missed their flights, Michael Fischer (@theMrMobile) of, well, he's Mr. Mobile and Josh hang out for an hour to talk MWC. Fashion starts the chat, with vests and suits. What you really want to hear about, best of the show, behind the scenes at how the guys work and actual tech talk. Wearable tech rears its head, watches are big with these two, as is photography. Last, what are your shortcuts on the Blackberry KEYone keyboard. The Android Authority Podcast - discussing topics in Android every week.   Rough Timecodes: 02:00 - Nicole Scott 12:00 - Juan Carlos Bagnell 37:00 - Michael Fisher

title: Qualcomm special episode
description: Joshua Vergara and David Imel spent a few days in San Diego with Qualcomm, Joe Hindy, Jonathan Feist and Adam Molina hung out at home, recording two separate mini-shows combine into this, a Qualcomm special episode of the Android Authority Podcast. Join the team as they recount their non-embargoed experience with Qualcomm and weather problems in southern California. Back at home, the news included Verizon's unlimited data plan, wow, as well as celebrating N.O.V.A. Legacy is on its way and Joe wants to help you use Google Maps a little more effectively. Stay tuned for a brand new show format coming soon, we want to get you, our faithful listeners, readers and viewers more involved in the show, and we think we have a solution. The Android Authority Podcast - discussing topics in Android every week. title: 099: It's not you, it's your phone
description: Joshua Vergara, Joe Hindy, Jonathan Feist and David Imel officially close out the double digits with episode 99 of the Android Authority Podcast. That might be a lie, with a special episode coming next week, delaying episode 100, but we're close! Topics around the team included love and dating, but specifically how iPhone users have been found to judge Android users poorly. Android Wear 2.0 is rolling out, but is the smartwatch the right medium? Samsung putting the fingerprint scanner beside the camera, weird, but is that a problem? But first, we express that we're not overly worried about the Google Now Launcher exiting the Play Store. Stay tuned for a brand new show format coming soon, we want to get you, our faithful listeners, readers and viewers more involved in the show, and we think we have a solution. title: 098: Razerbit gaming phone
description: Joshua Vergara, Jonathan Feist, David Imel and Adam Molina get excited for technology on the 98th episode of the Android Authority Podcast. Razer purchased Nextbit, so we imagine what will come of that, the Nexus 6 and Nexus 9 stop getting full OS updates, and patches only promised through 2017. Google Voice received its first real update in a long, long time, then we talk AI and AR, but not until after diving into a big topic, the immigration bans from President Donald Trump and how they affect the technology and companies behind the tech. Stay tuned for a brand new show format coming soon, we want to get you, our faithful listeners, readers and viewers more involved in the show, and we think we have a solution. The Android Authority Podcast - discussing topics in Android every week. title: 097: Retroactive resolutions
description: Joshua Vergara, Joe Hindy, Jonathan Feist, David Imel and Adam Molina take on the hard topics of the week, including figuring out what our personal resolutions mean to us, how many Twitter followers David has and that Joe turned a year older. Huga Barra announced he's leaving Xiaomi to come back to California, headed for Oculus under Facebook's control. We spend a few minutes talking about our thoughts on smartphone trends, specifically bezel sizes, leading to the topic of LG G6 vs Samsung Galaxy S8 - which are you more looking forward to? Stay tuned for a brand new show format coming soon, we want to get you, our faithful listeners, readers and viewers more involved in the show, and we think we have a solution. Happy (belated) Birthday Joe! The Android Authority Podcast - discussing topics in Android every week.   Rough Timecodes: Check in with our resolutions, goat workouts and a new laptop. 33:00 - Samsung talks Note 7 battery 43:00 - What we think of smartphone trends, particularly display bezels 57:00 - Hugo Barra leaving Xiaomi 79:00 - What are you more excited for, the LG G6 or the Samsung Galaxy S8   Relevant Links Android Authority Forums - Podcast discussionSamsung clears up Note 7 battery situation Is bezel-less the 2017 design trend Hugo Barra leaving Xiaomi, headed to Facebook LG G6 vs Galaxy S8 expectation roundup

title: 096: Soundbeards
description: Joshua Vergara, Joe Hindy, Jonathan Feist and David Imel are joined by an all new personality on the show, from our very own SoundGuys.com, Adam Molina. With a SoundGuys presence, it should be no surprise the crew talk about audio gear for a bit, sharing their headphones of choice and more. In addition, talk about apps and gaming gets surprised laughs that a prominent pop star is now a character in Final Fantasy, and we learn that Andy Rubin, one of the fathers of Android, is off working on a new phone project. Stay tuned for a brand new show format coming soon, we want to get you, our faithful listeners, readers and viewers more involved in the show, and we think we have a solution. The Android Authority Podcast - discussing topics in Android every week.   Rough Timecodes: Check in with our new guest and some weather. 32:00 - Ariana Grande in Final Fantasy BRAVE EXVIUS 38:00 - New Android Nintendo games! 43:00 - Google Allo 5.0 60:00 - OnePlus Bullets Headphones 71:00 - Andy Rubin, founder of Android, making a new phone/OS?
